result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mercedes C. Guzman

defendant.name: Guzman, Mercedes C.
defendant.address: 152 W. Main Street Apt. 4, Whitewater, WI 53190

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mercedes C. Guzman in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock. Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Upon motion of the State case is dismissed and read-in. Minutes filed.

Defendant Mercedes C. Guzman in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mercedes C. Guzman in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Was set for PLEAS, but defendant wishes to speak with her mother before proceeding. Court continues. Minutes filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Mercedes C. Guzman in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Mercedes C. Guzman in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Valerian A. Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Mercedes C. Guzman in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Haley J Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed. Not guilty plea entered. Information filed in court. Demand for Speedy trial. Trial dates set. Motion to Modify bond denied.  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 01:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 02:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mercedes C. Guzman in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Haley J Rea and Intern Ramneek Button appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Arraignment scheduled for June 24, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Mercedes C. Guzman in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.   Cody Horlacher appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed. Preliminary Hearing requested within time period.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Must post $500.00 Cash. Total Bond: 14GF529 (SO# 14-2400 and 14-2401)   Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH S.G. OR L.H. NO CONTACT WITH ANYONE FROM WHITEWATER POLICE DEPARTMENT EXCEPT IN PROFESSIONAL CAPACITY. NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH C.G.. No violent contact includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant appears in court, in custody, with Edward Bailey and attorney Melissa Nepomiachi for attorney Hammock. Dan Necci and intern Andrew Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
